summary: The 'College for All Act of 2025' aims to amend the Higher Education Act of 1965. Key provisions include establishing a federal-state partnership to eliminate tuition and fees at public colleges, providing grants to historically Black colleges and universities, and improving Federal Pell Grants. The bill also addresses student success grants, support for low-income and first-generation students, investments in minority-serving institutions, and outlines provisions relating to the Snyder Act.
